comments.commentBody: How soon you forgot the Oklahoma City bombing perpetrated by a fellow white American and non-Islamist. That one took down innocent women, children, and men. Homeland bred terrorism against its own people. That this has to be explained underscores the ignorance, apathy, and resulting paralysis that allows free rein to grave constitutional violations by these neo-con agencies.

As I said, Canada is not stellar on race relations and this is especially true of the Native population. Having said that, the black population of Nova Scotia emanates from the promise of the British to free any black slave who joined them in fighting the Americans during the Revolution. After the war's loss, the British helped thousands of blacks escape by ship to freedom in Nova Scotia in the 1780s. Of course, blacks suffered the prevailing racism of their times, but they were far more equal under the law and were not anybody's property. Nova Scotia's history shows underperformance of blacks but it does not put it out of place in the North American context.

Canada's black population has never been as large as the United State's but it's minority populations is significant in size and influence. Fully 1/6th of the Canadian population is foreign born and the only primarily white countries of the top ten sources are the US, UK and France.

As for prominent blacks in Canadian history, the "Father of British Columbia" was governor (1850-60s) Sir James Davis. Michaelle Jean was governor-general of Canada in the 2000s. Her predecessor was Chinese. William Hall was the third Canadian recipient of the Victoria Cross in 1859. Rose Fortune was the first female police officer in Canada in the 1820s.

These are only some examples. All of the above would be impossible in 18th and 19th century America for blacks.

The Democrats have had their opportunities to change the fillibuster rules, and have failed to do so.
It is beyond belief that they are not in some way complicit in this malfeasance.

It is ludicrous to think that this unprecedented Republican obstruction will change anytime soon. It must be dealt with.
And it's up to the Democratic Party to stop them.  They could stop them.   Democrats have a majority in the Senate.  Will they use that majority to change the filibuster rule?  Don't count on it.

I don't care what Judges are nominated and confirmed by either party.

All Judges are inherently conservative in that they predominantly rule in favor of authority over the individual citing the root of law being within the realm of government.

Besides, they know where their paychecks and future advancement are determined.

Those unpriestly black vestments should tell you a lot.
Please read the story, the vote was 53 to 38.  9 senators did not vote.  Please castigate the non voters, not the 91 who voted.

January is the time for Senate Democrats to change the  Court appointment rules including the Supreme Court.  While the Republicans will oink, howl, and catterwhale  loudly, the public's  memory will have faded by November.

C'mon he is not a sociopath.  But he did behave badly as a husband of a terminally ill wife and a presidential candidate.  Hopefully, his ego is not too huge thus he can learn a lesson from it instead of placing the blame on others. I could imagine how Elizabeth must feel in her final hours. A decent husband should have done his very best to provide his dying wife a content and peaceful closure.
Judge not lest ye be judged -- wow are you judgmental
I'll go with Narcissistic Personality

According to "Psychology Today," definition of sociopath:

Superficial charm and good intelligence
Absence of delusions and other signs of irrational thinking
Absence of nervousness or neurotic manifestations
Unreliability
Untruthfulness and insincerity
Lack of remorse and shame
Inadequately motivated antisocial behavior
Poor judgment and failure to learn by experience
Pathologic egocentricity and incapacity for love
General poverty in major affective reactions
Specific loss of insight
Unresponsiveness in general interpersonal relations
Fantastic and uninviting behavior with alcohol and sometimes without
Suicide threats rarely carried out
Sex life impersonal, trivial, and poorly integrated
Failure to follow any life plan

five, I'm not about to overlook 66A, simply bec it was plain awFULL!

Howie all await Martin's defense of it's inclusion
Come on, Harry Reid. Change the filibuster rule. Let the majority do its work and let the Republicans fume. They're going to lose most of the election in 2014 anyway.
Your vote is meaningless an exercise in false hope. Our voting elected a feckless disingenuous president and a dysfunctional congress. We are prisoners of the plutocrats.
Do you honestly believe the Republicans wouldn't banish the judicial filibuster if the tables were turned?  Things are different today than they were 8 years ago.

There is nothing wrong with the Republican strategy -- just as Democrats' method of getting Obamacare passed was loaded with political shenanigans, the Republicans can play the same game.

This is about power. Politics has long been a way to avoid war, and this is no different.
We are not a democracy. That's an illusion. Corporations rule.
No.

If the Republicans  want to impose parliamentary style discipline on the legislature, than Democrats  need to assert the  advantage of the parliamentary system -  that of majority vote regarding legislation and appointments.  Republicans  are just going to run roughshod if they're ever in the majority so why wait?

Hogwash.

The idea that the Dems have behaved anywhere remotely like the GOP has in the past 5 years with presidential nominees is provably false.

The Federalist papers DID comment on something like this, but it was Madison talking about being wary of factions; factions like the Tea Party.

Well qnot so many others because  he was re-elected!   I am old enough to remember the cowardly and uncaring Republicans (The American Firsters) who tried every way to stop this country from entering  WWII.  I believe the people who are rejecting these nominations are not doing it because they think they think the nominees are liberal.  They would do it if if the nominees were Republican.  They HATE the idea of Obama.  They have  tried to stop him in every way.  Even when some policies were originally Republican.  The president has cut the deficit almost in half so he is being fiscally responsible.  Soldiers will be coming home from Afghanistan.  So why  is it you dislike him  so much?  Is it because he is trying help all those medically uninsured get insurance(like every single other western country in the world)?  I have insurance, Medicare and an excellent supplemental so I'm not looking for myself.  Are you also against helping those devastated by storms?  Are you one of those Republicans who dislike Gov. Christie because he was great-full that Obama showed up after the  storm damage in New Jersey.  Isn't this  the type of behavior we teach our children?  You don't have to be a Democrat,  Republican or Libertarian to have acceptable values.  You just have to be fair, decent.

And those of us who voted for O simply don't count.

Only the votes devoted to the GOP matter.

Brilliant.

The Republicans are well within their legal and Constitutional rights when they block the President's left-leaning judicial nominations, and what's more they're doing exactly what I, and so many others, elected them to do.

I truly wonder if there is not a theme here. This guy seems like the Rick Perry of Canada. Is it simply that the radical right, defined as carefully selected and picked by a wealthy elite, is by definition corrupt?
If this fellow is not "corrupt", would Rick Perry's denying health care to hundreds of thousands of Texas citizens qualify as a, "noble gesture"?
The whole story sickens me.
What a charmer?
another politician as asupreme narcissist...yawn....
chris farley would have been the best.

Well, it's good to know that the Canadians occasionally elect sociopaths just like Americans do. To the good folks north of the border: sit back and relax for the rest of 2013. Rob Ford will entertain you with his own special brand of self-destructing imploding fireworks!
Or non-oversight in this case!
Canadians depend on our elected officials to have some sense of shame.

He was a wannabe. he sat on the bench all season at Carleton University (Ottawa).

As for recall? Its not in the constitution nationally but some jurisdictions out west have it. No impeachment either but he (and many think our prime minister too) sure is a poster boy for it.

It says he is a former football player. One too many head bonks perchance?

And why doesn't Canada have a recall provision in their system? What a huge oversight!

Agreed. Reminds me of the film "Network", and might well have a similar ending. It's difficult, but I try to keep reminding myself that online comments aren't necessarily representative of people in general.

This man is in a meltdown.  Doesn't Canada have 5150 laws?  He appears to be a danger to himself and possibly to others.  We are watching self-destruction and I can take no enjoyment in it, despite his politics.  He needs help and soon.
